data.title: Ellis Clark Bio
images: https://www.ellisclark.com/CAUDog Records Logo_Black Background_For Print_High Resolution_Red.jpg
data.text:
Listen to Ellis Clark Music on ReverbNation. Click here:

Welcome to EllisClark.com

A website that celebrates the musical history of Ellis Clark past, present and future

About Ellis Clark

Ellis Clark has been a longtime fixture of the Chicago music community working nationally as a performing musician with his band Ellis Clark & The Big Parade, as a songwriter for himself or other artists, a recording artist and record producer. As a teenager he was a founding member of the power-pop-punk pioneer band Epicycle releasing several singles and a full length LP by the time he was nineteen. Later, he fronted Social Act who received heavy radio play, toured nationally & released numerous albums of original material.

View Ellis Clark Discography as a Musician.

Recognized for his songwriting skills, Clark was signed to Paramount Pictureâs publishing division Famous Music. He co-founded Cirkle Records & Idiot Savant Records and is currently Producer for all albums released on the internationally distributed CAUDog Records label. He is also proud to be a part of Chicago Acoustic Underground, an organization that has a shared dedication to the development of new artists. Whether it be in New York, Chicago or Los Angeles, he has shared the bill with Nine Inch Nails, The Smashing Pumpkins, Blondie, Dave Davies (The Kinks), Glenn Tilbrook (Squeeze), UB40, The Neville Brothers, Evan Dando from The Lemonheads, NRBQ, The Brian Jonestown Massacre, Liquid Soul, The Plimsouls and the late SNL star Chris Farley to name a few.

In 2013, Clark released his debut solo album âLP NUMBER ONEâ on the CAUDog Record Label as a red vinyl LP, CD (and even 8-TRACK TAPE). (click here to purchase: http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/ellisclark) Clarkâs wide range of producer/engineering/session player credits include working on records with Kim Thayil (Soundgarden), American Idol Star Crystal Bowersox, guitarist Lenny Kaye from The Patti Smith Group, 90âs indie pop favorite The Chamber Strings, co-producer of all Kevin Tihista & Red Terrorâs albums released on Atlantic Records and Broken Horse, John Ashton from The Psychedelic Furs, Carla Prather from Poi Dog Pondering, The Amazing Heeby Jeebies, The Handcuffs (whoâs songs have been featured on many nationally syndicated TV shows aired on MTV, PBS, A&E, VH1, NBC and ABC), and he produced the late Nikki Suddenâs âRed Brocadeâ album (with Jeff Tweedy of Wilco). View Ellis Clark Discography as a Producer.

To Book a live performance by Ellis Clark & The Big Parade please contact us at: ellisclarkmusic@gmail.com His performances include tunes from his entire music catalog past & present. Ellis & The Big Parade also love to include at their shows favorite tunes from the 50's, 60's & 70's from the likes of The Kinks, Who, Beatles & Garage Rock Classics and much more!

Book Ellis Clark & The Big Parade now to rock out your next event.

Ellis also performs acoustic "Unplugged" for smaller venues.

New Ellis Clark & The Big Parade Shirts are Now Out!

Available in 3/4 Sleeve Baseball Shirts ($22) and regular Tees's ($12) Includes postage & handling. Please specify small, medium, large or extra large, and the quantity you would like, when ordering.
